p: The ZOI differed marginally with different capsules and microorganisms used in the assay. Both the samples and the standard drug were detected to be inhibitory to P. aeruginosa and E. coli, and the EC-I oil was showed to be the most active agent. The MIC of EC-G oil was observed to be 0.5 and 1 mg/mL, whereas that of EC-I was 0.25 and 0.5 mg/mL against P. aeruginosa and E. coli respectively. Thus, the EC-I oil was more active against both the Gram-negative bacteria.
